channel.title: A few questions for advanced coders
channel.description:
[size=15pt]A few questions for advanced coders...[/size]
1: Attacking Error OK, when I use a melee weapon and attack a player, it hits them. Then when they walk away, my character doesn't follow them and they still get damaged. My character doesn't move, and still they get damaged even if they are far away. Does anyone know how to solve this?
2: Port-forwarding I did everything I need in order to port-forward. Still, nobody can log into my server. I set the variables. I added port to firewall exceptions. How can I solve it?
3: Mage/Range NPC How do I make an NPC attack with mage or range instead of melee?
4: Anti-lag I assume that you've heard of [b]ZdiddyScape[/b]? Around a month ago, there was a poll on which server was the best. ZdiddyScape was ranked [b]1[/b]. That server, and all the other popular servers are lag-proof. Whenever I [b]mass click[/b] on training objects, such as dummies, on their server, it doesn't lag. My server lags when I do hat. The ZdiddyScape owner said that there is no anti-lag code. He told me to just base my training on NPCs. A few people told me to add timers - but I already have actionTimer in the object case. Others said they saw a tutorial on how to make it lag-proof, but they won't give me the link. Just want to ask if there is a code that makes it anti-lag, and what the link to the tutorial is.

item.title: A few questions for advanced coders
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

It’s true, I have previously posted this. Th previous post has died out, so I started a new one. It’s not counted as havig multple threads though. Who would leave their questions unsolved? -_-

Read full topic
item.source: A few questions for advanced coders

item.title: A few questions for advanced coders
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

[size=15pt]A few questions for advanced coders…[/size]

1: Attacking Error
OK, when I use a melee weapon and attack a player, it hits them. Then when they walk away, my character doesn’t follow them and they still get damaged. My character doesn’t move, and still they get damaged even if they are far away. Does anyone know how to solve this?

2: Port-forwarding
I did everything I need in order to port-forward. Still, nobody can log into my server. I set the variables. I added port to firewall exceptions. How can I solve it?

3: Mage/Range NPC
How do I make an NPC attack with mage or range instead of melee?

4: Anti-lag
I assume that you’ve heard of ZdiddyScape? Around a month ago, there was a poll on which server was the best. ZdiddyScape was ranked 1. That server, and all the other popular servers are lag-proof. Whenever I mass click on training objects, such as dummies, on their server, it doesn’t lag. My server lags when I do hat. The ZdiddyScape owner said that there is no anti-lag code. He told me to just base my training on NPCs. A few people told me to add timers - but I already have actionTimer in the object case. Others said they saw a tutorial on how to make it lag-proof, but they won’t give me the link. Just want to ask if there is a code that makes it anti-lag, and what the link to the tutorial is.

Read full topic
item.source: A few questions for advanced coders
